poem:
A Meeting in Scotland  

In the cradle of heather and ancient stone,  
Ursula meets Donald, over a fairway's edge,  
words—a bargain of goods, a friendly exchange.  
While the North Sea whispers, wavering,  
they craft a bridge of commerce  
under the wide, watchful sky,   
as the wind threads through the links,  
finding its own quiet accord.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Von der Leyen to meet Trump in Scotland as EU and US close in on trade deal The EU appears to be on the verge of signing a trade deal with Donald Trump after the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, announced she would meet the US president on Sunday during his four-day trip to Scotland. Trump was scheduled to land on Friday evening before the opening of his new golf course in Aberdeenshire". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Von der Leyen to meet Trump in Scotland as EU and US close in on trade deal The EU appears to be on the verge of signing a trade deal with Donald Trump after the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, announced she would meet the US president on Sunday during his four-day trip to Scotland. Trump was scheduled to land on Friday evening before the opening of his new golf course in Aberdeenshire
